intro: Auriculardisia capitellata, commonly known as the ear-shaped daisy, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, yellow flowers with distinctive, ear-shaped bracts that give it its common name. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats and is often found in grasslands and savannas. Its botanical structure includes a slender stem, alternate leaves, and a compact inflorescence.
